title: New PANDEMO 350 Mountain e-Bike
text: As seen in the February edition of the GETAWAY. Pandemo 350 is brand new and the best value for e-bikes currently on the SA e-bike market. It is a rugged mountain e-bike designed for beginner and interim cyclists, and available in different sizes to suit all cyclists, young and old.Its great features include 5 different assistance levels, supplied by a powerful 350-watt motor housed in the rear wheel hub, a Shimano 21-gear set, and a 36-volt long lasting lithium-ion battery.A bright LED light is standard equipment. The LCD screen is illuminated to facilitate night cycling, and provides essential cumulative and trip data including speed, distance, time, battery condition and instantaneous power consumption. Plus, you’ll always feel safe on these great bikes knowing that Tektro 160 front and rear disks are fitted!Great e-bikes and scooters from SA Ebikes. Visit our website at www.saebikes.com for more information, and to place your order now!WE DELIVER COUNTRYWIDE

title: Well loved Mountain Bike looking for a new home
text:
Number of bikes in this bike
cave needs to be X=N-1    :-(My owner (heartless
&@#$!@#~) upgraded to a newer (younger) model despite me never giving him
any issues (me-thinks mid-life crisis = “It” has bigger ...... wheels than me
:-( and fewer gears).Currently I am on display in
the pain cave (up on a pedestal for him to feel guilty about not using me
anymore) but I need to go to a Good Home.I have been well looked after
and maintained regularly. I even got him into the race snakes batches (much to
his disgust/exhaustion). I have been treated to a half tubeless conversion (my
"rear"). The front tire is running a slime tube with an old tube as
an extra liner.Large frame (19") in
“arctic” white and “rouge” red with some skimpy sexy black trim.I have two rear wheels - one
that is tubeless (and comes with a bottle of sealant) and the other that has a
"slick" tyre (for attempted boredom on a dumb trainer - maybe 40km
use) and a Maxxis Highroller & Kenda small block 8 spare.Plus two more slime tubes as
spare and another normal tube.Before the tubeless conversion
my rear wheels were rotated more regularly to spread out the wear.I have Shimano spd pedals on
already but there is the option of brand new still in the box Ryder flat/spd
style pedals (with unused cleats) that can be put on instead.Hydraulic Disk Brakes = 180 mm
Front and 160 mm Rear.*Disclaimer - My Brakes work
the CORRECT way round according to the UK and if you ride a motorcycle. This
means Back Brake is on the left and Front Brake is on the Right... your LBS
(local bike shop) can switch the hoses around and re-bleed them.























*Owner's note: I love this bike
and hope it goes to a good home - the lure of the 1x12 and the 29er upgrade has
meant this bike "has" to go, although I still found it much more
controllable than the 29er - and I still keep searching for the higher and
lower gear ratios that this bike offers. Since moving to JHB in 2018 it has had
limited use and then none at all since winter last year.SilverBack Alpine 1

Large frame (19") in “arctic” white and “rouge” red with some
skimpy sexy black trim.Fork:
Rock Shox Recon Silver TK Solo Air (Lockout but not remote)Front
Derailleur: Shimano DeoreRear
Derailleur: Shimano XTShifters:
Shimano Deore Rapidfire PlusCrankset:
Shimano M590 (22/32/44T)Cassette:
Shimano HG50-9 (11-32T) x 2Chain:
Shimano with quick/missing/power-link - Still in good condition (<0.5%)Brakes:
Shimano M445 Hydraulic Disc*Wheels:
AlexRims DC4.5Disc Rear (Tubeless) and Shimano Hub AlexRims TD25 front AND
"spare" rear (complete)Tyres:
MAXXIS CROSSMARK 26x2.25 Tubeless REAR - KENDA Small Block Eight Front (with
slime tubes) + Maxxis Highroller (used) and another small block as spares plus slime
tubes and normal tube spares.Stem:
Silverback SBCHandlebar:
Silverback SBC Advanced DynamicsSeatpost:
Silverback SBCSaddle:
Silverback



























Pedals:
Shimano SPD - and/or Ryder platform/spd

title: B'n B'nB? BED, BREAKFAST AND BICYCLE!
text: Come for a stay at Thrush Nest - have a wonderful sleep at our b&b, enjoy a hearty breakfast, and we will escort you to Giba Gorge Mountain Bike Park! If there was an MTB heaven, then this would be it! - beginner rides, moderate rides, extreme rides, bmx track, medical standby, bike repair techhies on hand, great restaurant, beautiful picnic spots in the lush sub-tropical bush, with waterfalls, rivers, and wonderful scenic walks. Only 6km from our BnB, Bring your bike or hire one there. Entrance - non rider - R20-00, Own bike - R80-00, Child - own bike - R50-00 . Basic MTB hire - R200-00 for 2 hours - prices vary depending on your requirements - payment at park..BnB: R750-00 per room per night with English breakfast.

title: 26" GT Avalanche 2.0, EXTRA LARGE, Shimano 24spd, Hydraulic Brakes
text:
This GT Avalanche 2.0 is a great starter bike for anyone who is trying to get fit or is interested in MTB.  It's and Extra Large so it's suitable for a tall rider well over 6ft.  The bike is neat and well looked after. 

This is a strong and durable bike and it comes with:

-Extra Large lightweight and durable GT Tripple Triangle Aluminum Alloy frame
-SR Suntour XCR Magnesium coilspring front suspension with lockout
-Tektro Auriga Hydraulic Disk Brakes front and back
-Shimano Rapid fire 8 and 3 speed shifter
-Shimano SLX (Pro Grade) rear and Altus front deraileurs
-Shimano 3 speed SiS alloy crankset 
-Aluminum Alloy Jalco AX430 rims with Formula alloy hubs
-26" knobby off-road tyres in excellet condition, lots of tread left
-Alloy saddle post, clamp and GTllWTB Saddle
-GT long alloy stem and GT handlebars with brand new grippers

Extras: Bottle cage

THE PRICE IS SLIGHTLY NEGOTIABLE AND DELIVERY CAN BE ARRANGED.

title: Commencal Meta 29r (2019)
text: I purchased my bike at the end of 2018, raced all the KwaZulu Natal enduro races and one Western Cape enduro race on it during 2019 and then the bike sat in a box for 15 months. I am moving over seas in a few months so I decided to sell my bike to help me finance the move. All the parts (aside from the front rim) are original and have had no issues whatsoever. This bike is ideal for enduro racing and is also capable enough for most of our South African downhill races. I’m hoping to sell this bike to someone who will love it and ride it as hard as I have. Due to the bike’s travel there are a few surface-level blemishes on the frame.The bike has just had a full service so nothing needs replacing or work.
location: Devils Peak, Cape Town, Western Cape

title: Motorized bikes
text:
A standard bicycle fitted with an 49cc or 66/80cc, 1.7kW Motor.

Fitted with a 2l petrol tank capable of delivering an estimated range of 90km’s.

The bicycle, with its small engine capacity, still qualifies as a bicycle, which means no licensing or roadworthy certificate are required.

The bicycle is able to effectively operate with a person weighing up to 115kg and is estimated to reach 40km/h.

This is a cost effective innovation which I believe will be perfect for visual patrolling and rapid/easy response just about anywhere, requiring very little maintenance.

The engine is fitted with a magneto, which can be utilized to power up lights if necessary.

We can supply complete bicycles to suit your needs or modify your current bicycle to your specifications.

These bicycles are extremely easy to use and operates with a clutch system similar to that of a motorcycle.

Replacement parts are readily available.

For more information, please don’t hesitate to call me 0717156081

title: Santa Cruz Blur CC 2019
text:
Sale by second owner
I am selling my Santa Cruz Blur CC MTB, size is a
XL, originally Greg Minnaar’s bike with the following specs:
Full Shimano XTR 11 Speed paired with XTR Cranks
and Reserve 27’s Laced onto Chris King hubs wheelset.
Crank Brother Candy pedals are included.
Grips – Burgtec Minnaar Edition
The bike rides amazingly well! The colour of the
bike orange.
Why am I selling, upgrade time!!! This bike has
mainly been used for training and has done the occasional race here and there,
otherwise in a really good condition.
I am not in a hurry to sell the bike and won’t
accept silly offers.
Contact me if you need more info, pics or deliveryR76 000
Photo credit @retroyspective - This is the actual
bike from the VNA Santa Cruz Blur CC Launch in 2019, check out the story
